summary: Email chain between attorneys Suzanne Jaffe Bloom and Johanna Rae Hudgens of Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing transcripts, and sharing information about phone records showing contacts between the client and underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; coordinating with prosecutors and her associate.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney working with Suzanne Jaffe Bloom on the grand jury subpoena matter; involved in scheduling and communications.

connections.description: Partners/associates at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on a client's grand jury subpoena case.
Bloom has been formally retained to represent the client in connection with a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: SDNY grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date for grand jury appearance listed in subpoena, which was adjourned.

events.title: Proposed Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorneys propose meeting with prosecutors to discuss the subpoena.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed client represented by Winston & Strawn LLP.
Prosecutors indicated they have contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The original grand jury appearance date of July 24, 2019, was adjourned as discussions about a possible voluntary interview continued.
The emails reference several civil cases related to Jeffrey Epstein, including docket numbers for cases in SDNY and Florida.
The correspondence shows coordination between defense counsel and prosecutors regarding evidence sharing and meeting scheduling.
